Invoking: `validate` with `{'patch': '--- a/ext/pdo_sqlite/sqlite_driver.c\n+++ b/ext/pdo_sqlite/sqlite_driver.c\n@@ -754,7 +754,7 @@\n \tif (*filename && strncasecmp(filename, "file:", 5) == 0) {\n \t\tif (PG(open_basedir) && *PG(open_basedir)) {\n \t\t\treturn NULL;\n \t\t}\n \t\treturn estrdup(filename);\n \t}\n-\tif (*filename && memcmp(filename, ":memory:", sizeof(":memory:"))) {\n+\tif (*filename && strcmp(filename, ":memory:") != 0) {\n \t\tchar *fullpath = expand_filepath(filename, NULL);\n \n \t\tif (!fullpath) {\n \t\t\treturn NULL;\n \t\t}\n \n \t\tif (php_check_open_basedir(fullpath)) {\n \t\t\tefree(fullpath);\n \t\t\treturn NULL;\n \t\t}\n \t\treturn fullpath;\n \t}\n \treturn estrdup(filename);\n }'}`
responded: The bug is in this line:
```c
if (*filename && memcmp(filename, ":memory:", sizeof(":memory:"))) {
```
Here, `memcmp(filename, ":memory:", sizeof(":memory:"))` will read 9 bytes from `filename`, but if `filename` is shorter than 9 bytes, this will read past the end of the allocated buffer, causing a heap buffer overflow.

**Correct fix:**  
We should only call `memcmp` if `filename` is at least as long as `":memory:"` (8 characters, plus the null terminator, so 9 bytes).  
So, we should check `strlen(filename) + 1 >= sizeof(":memory:")` before calling `memcmp`, or more simply, use `strncmp` instead of `memcmp` and compare only the first 8 characters (without the null terminator), or use `strcmp` if we want to check for exact match.

But the original code seems to want to check if the filename is exactly `":memory:"`. So, the best fix is to use `strcmp(filename, ":memory:")`.

**Patch:**
Replace
```c
if (*filename && memcmp(filename, ":memory:", sizeof(":memory:"))) {
```
with
```c
if (*filename && strcmp(filename, ":memory:") != 0) {
```

This avoids the buffer overflow and preserves the logic.
